subject: Business
title: Disruption from Below: The Low-End Attack
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Disruption from Below: The Low-End Attack.

hook.text: Southwest Airlines offered no meals, no assigned seats, and no frills. Airlines laughed.

buildup.text: Low-end disruption targets overserved customers who don't need all the features incumbents offer.

discovery.text: Disruptors strip away features to offer a simpler, cheaper product that's 'good enough' for most customers.

twist.text: Incumbents gladly shed low-profit customers. They don't realize that those customers were the majority of the market.

climax.text: Mini steel mills disrupted US Steel. They started with rebar (low-margin) and climbed to structural steel (high-margin).

punchline.text: The products people laugh at today dominate tomorrow.

quiz.question: How does low-end disruption typically begin?
options: By offering a simpler, cheaper product to overserved customers
By creating the most advanced product possible
By copying the incumbent's strategy exactly
